body_text.text: Fitted parameters defined by the smooth line through each of the data sets are summarized in Table S1 . emission intensity, specifically in this context, is comparable to that observed in the double-labeled Cy3-5'TRS-Cy5-3'-cTRS duplex (see Fig. 6C , main text). This enhancement is consistent with proteininduced fluorescence emission (PIFE). 2

BIBREF0.title: Analysis of equilibrium and kinetic measurements to determine thermodynamic origins of stability and specificity and mechanism of formation of site-specific complexes between proteins and helical DNA

BIBREF1.title: Cytosolic viral sensor RIG-I Is a 5'-Triphosphate-dependent translocase on doublestranded RNA

FIGREF0.text: Sequence alignment of N proteins from groups I (TGEV), group II (BCoV, MHV and SARS-CoV), and group III (IBV) generated using ClustalW. The NTD is shaded in grey and the CTD is shaded in pink. The domain boundaries of MHV N197 (residues 60-197), N219 (residues 60-219) and the CTD (residues 256-385) are indicated by the asterisks, with R110, Y127 and Y129 highlighted (filled squares).

FIGREF1.text: Salt back titration of complexes formed by wild-type N219 and wild-type N197 with the decanucleotide TRS. (A) Protein-RNA complexes were formed in the usual way at 0.15 M K + (50 mM K phosphate, 100 mM KCl, log [K + ]=-0.82) and small additions of a concentrated stock solution of KCl was added to obtain the indicated total[K+]. The anisotropy, r obs , was converted to K obs as described inMethods. The slope of the linear fit to the each data set is defined as SK obs , the stoichiometry of K + release from the TRS RNA. The maximum value of SK obs is ≈7 for the 10-nucleotide TRS RNA. The other parameters in panel B are as defined in the footnote to the

FIGREF2.text: 1 H, 15 N chemical shift perturbation plot of Y127A N219 relative to wild-type N197 (∆ppm vs. residue number with secondary structural elements shown; seeFig. 3, main text) . ∆ppm = sqrt[reflects perturbations around the site of the Y127A substitution (β3 strand) as well as in the immediately adjacent β1 strand.

FIGREF3.text: The N219-mediated unwinding of a fluorescently labeled TRS:cTRS duplex is reversible with the addition of KCl to low-FRET N219-ssRNA complexes. Left panel, Aliquots of 10 µM Cy5-3'-cTRS was titrated into 50 nM Cy3-5'-TRS to a 1.1:1 ratio to form the TRS-cTRA duplex. At the first arrow, N219 was titrated into the duplex at the indicated concentration until the FRET efficiency fell to zero (middle panel). At that time, KCl was added (second arrow) to indicated concentration with the FRET efficiency returning to that of the fully formed duplex. (right panel). These data reveal that duplex unwinding by N219 is reversible upon dissociation of the complex with monovalent salt (seeFig. S2) and rules out RNA degradation as a source of the low FRET efficiency observed upon incuabation with N219, or other NTD proteins.

FIGREF4.text: Y127A N219 binds to the Cy5-3'-cTRS-TRS syn duplex and exhibits PIFE, but not the to the single-stranded Cy5-3'-cTRS RNA. (a) Cy5 emission spectra (λ ex =610 nm) of 10 nM Cy5-3'-cTRS RNA obtained in the presence (red) and absence (blue) of saturating (12 µM) Y127A N219. There is no change in the quantum yield (I A ) of Cy5 under conditions where Y127A N219 binds RNA (as measured by a change in the anisotropy). (b) Cy5 emission spectra 10 nM Cy5-3'-cTRS-TRS syn duplex recorded in the presence (red) and absence (blue-dash) of saturating (12 µM) Y127A N219. Note the enhanced Cy5
